intro: Pseudoselago pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful false selago, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features succulent leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
